intro: Maesa macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaved maesa, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its broad, glossy leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. It produces small, dark berries that are an important food source for various wildlife. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological and horticultural contexts.
